title.narrative: OP2: BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitor inclusive, equitable and quality basic education services, focusing on early grades.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitor inclusive, equitable and quality basic education services, focusing on early grades.

description.narrative: UNICEF expanded support through the EU-supported Partnership to Strengthen the Education Sector (PSES) contributed to strengthening education sector capacity in measuring learning outcomes; M&E; planning, budgeting and financial management; policy dialogue; design, implementation and monitoring of evidence-based interventions; and to institutionalize a pedagogical advisory support system as well as equitable allocation of teachers. Sector coordination has been facilitated, including in the development of the new sector plan, identification of new GPE grant priorities, and in emergency response. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Teachers - The scope and quality of national teacher professional development - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Schools that received support from UNICEF through the child-friendly school or similar model
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
